Create metadata templates

Source: vignettes/create_metadata_templates.Rmd
create_metadata_templates.Rmd

Templating functions

Metadata templates store content that is converted into EML. Each template is created by a function that reads a data object, extracts as much information as possible, then writes this information to file for the user to add information to if necessary. Each templating function focuses on a specific metadata feature thereby allowing the user to build metadata in a modular fashion. Currently available templating functions include:

  • template_core_metadata() Create core metadata templates required by all data packages (abstract, methods, keywords, personnel, license). The additional information template (optional) is included.
  • template_table_attributes() Create attribute metadata for data tables, including column definitions, classes, and missing value codes. The custom units template is created incase non-standard units need definition.
  • template_categorical_variables() Create categorical variable metadata for data tables, if needed.
  • template_geographic_coverage() Create geographic coverage describing location names, points, and areas.
  • template_taxonomic_coverage() Create taxonomic coverage metadata facilitating resolution to authority systems and returning hierarchical rank names.

Below is a demonstration of each function and a look at outputs.

template_core_metadata()

Use template_core_metadata() to create metadata templates required by every data package.

# Continuing with the data package directory ("pkg_301") set up in
# the article "Organize data package" ...

# The templates directory is empty
dir('./pkg_301/metadata_templates')
## character(0)
# Template core metadata
template_core_metadata(
  path = './pkg_301/metadata_templates',
  license = 'CC0'
)
## Templating core metadata ...
## abstract.txt
## additional_info.txt
## intellectual_rights.txt
## keywords.txt.
## methods.txt
## personnel.txt
## Done.
# Core templates are now present
dir('./pkg_301/metadata_templates')
## [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
## [3] "intellectual_rights.txt" "keywords.txt"           
## [5] "methods.txt"             "personnel.txt"

template_table_attributes()

Use template_table_attributes() to create templates required by data tables.

# Add a couple tables to "pkg_301"

file.copy(
  from = system.file('/examples/data/nitrogen.csv', package = 'EMLassemblyline'),
  to = './pkg_301/data_objects'
)
## [1] TRUE
file.copy(
  from = system.file('/examples/data/decomp.csv', package = 'EMLassemblyline'),
  to = './pkg_301/data_objects'
)
## [1] TRUE
# Tables are now present
dir('./pkg_301/data_objects')
## [1] "decomp.csv"   "nitrogen.csv"
# Template table attributes for each table
template_table_attributes(
  path = './pkg_301/metadata_templates',
  data.path = './pkg_301/data_objects',
  data.table = c('decomp.csv', 'nitrogen.csv')
)
## Templating table attributes ...
## attributes_decomp.txt.
## attributes_nitrogen.txt.
## custom_units.txt
## Done.
# Table attributes templates are now present
dir('./pkg_301/metadata_templates')
## [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
## [3] "attributes_decomp.txt"   "attributes_nitrogen.txt"
## [5] "custom_units.txt"        "intellectual_rights.txt"
## [7] "keywords.txt"            "methods.txt"            
## [9] "personnel.txt"
# View templates
# NOTE: attributeName and class are autogenerated, and unit and 
# dateTimeFormatString note where specific content is needed.
attributes_decomp.txt
attributeName attributeDefinition class unit dateTimeFormatString missingValueCode missingValueCodeExplanation
type categorical
date Date !Add datetime specifier here!
arm numeric !Add units here!
ntrt categorical
year Date !Add datetime specifier here!
percent_loss numeric !Add units here!
taxa character
attributes_nitrogen.txt
attributeName attributeDefinition class unit dateTimeFormatString missingValueCode missingValueCodeExplanation
date Date !Add datetime specifier here!
ntrt categorical
arm numeric !Add units here!
net_primary_production numeric !Add units here!
stem_mass_density numeric !Add units here!
plant_density numeric !Add units here!
stem_n_concentration numeric !Add units here!
n_assimilated numeric !Add units here!
site_name categorical
site_lon numeric !Add units here!
site_lat numeric !Add units here!

template_categorical_variables()

Use template_categorical_variables() if any data table contains categorical variables.

# Replace partially complete table attributes templates with fully completed 
# ones as required by template_categorical_variables()

file.copy(
  from = system.file('/examples/templates/attributes_nitrogen.txt', package = 'EMLassemblyline'),
  to = './pkg_301/metadata_templates',
  overwrite = TRUE
)
## [1] TRUE
file.copy(
  from = system.file('/examples/templates/attributes_decomp.txt', package = 'EMLassemblyline'),
  to = './pkg_301/metadata_templates',
  overwrite = TRUE
)
## [1] TRUE
# Template categorical variables
template_categorical_variables(
  path = './pkg_301/metadata_templates',
  data.path = './pkg_301/data_objects'
)
## Templating categorical variables ...
## catvars_decomp.txt
## catvars_nitrogen.txt
## Done.
# Categorical variable templates are now present
dir('./pkg_301/metadata_templates')
##  [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
##  [3] "attributes_decomp.txt"   "attributes_nitrogen.txt"
##  [5] "catvars_decomp.txt"      "catvars_nitrogen.txt"   
##  [7] "custom_units.txt"        "intellectual_rights.txt"
##  [9] "keywords.txt"            "methods.txt"            
## [11] "personnel.txt"
# View templates
# NOTE: attributeName and code is auto generated.
catvars_decomp.txt
attributeName code definition
type Sphagnum
type Vascular
arm 1
arm 2
arm 3
arm NA
ntrt C
ntrt 0
ntrt 5
ntrt 10
ntrt 15
ntrt 20
ntrt 25
catvars_nitrogen.txt
attributeName code definition
ntrt C
ntrt 0
ntrt 5
ntrt 10
ntrt 15
ntrt 20
ntrt 25
arm 1
arm 2
arm 3

template_geographic_coverage()

Use template_geographic_coverage() to document the locations of sampling points or areas. NOTE: Use the empty = TRUE argument to create a blank version of this template for manual editing.

# Template geographic coverage
template_geographic_coverage(
  path = './pkg_301/metadata_templates',
  data.path = './pkg_301/data_objects',
  data.table = 'nitrogen.csv',
  site.col = 'site_name',
  lat.col = 'site_lat',
  lon.col = 'site_lon'
)
## Templating geographic coverage ...
## geographic_coverage.txt
## Done.
# The geographic coverage template has been added
dir('./pkg_301/metadata_templates')
##  [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
##  [3] "attributes_decomp.txt"   "attributes_nitrogen.txt"
##  [5] "catvars_decomp.txt"      "catvars_nitrogen.txt"   
##  [7] "custom_units.txt"        "geographic_coverage.txt"
##  [9] "intellectual_rights.txt" "keywords.txt"           
## [11] "methods.txt"             "personnel.txt"
# View template
geographic_coverage.txt
geographicDescription northBoundingCoordinate southBoundingCoordinate eastBoundingCoordinate westBoundingCoordinate
site_1 45.23 45.23 -89.43 -89.43
site_2 45.24 45.24 -89.44 -89.44
site_3 45.25 45.25 -89.45 -89.45
site_4 45.26 45.26 -89.46 -89.46
site_5 45.27 45.27 -89.47 -89.47
site_6 45.28 45.28 -89.48 -89.48
site_7 45.29 45.29 -89.49 -89.49
site_8 45.3 45.3 -89.5 -89.5
site_9 45.31 45.31 -89.51 -89.51
site_10 45.32 45.32 -89.52 -89.52

template_taxonomic_coverage()

Use template_taxonomic_coverage() to automatically resolve taxa to authority systems and create hierarchical rank specific metadata.

# Template taxonomic coverage
template_taxonomic_coverage(
  path = './pkg_301/metadata_templates',
  data.path = './pkg_301/data_objects',
  taxa.table = 'decomp.csv',
  taxa.col = 'taxa',
  taxa.authority = c(3,11),
  taxa.name.type = 'both'
)
## Templating taxonomic coverage ...
## Searching ITIS for "Mosses"
## Searching GBIF Backbone Taxonomy for "Mosses"
## Searching ITIS for "Unsorted biomass"
## Searching GBIF Backbone Taxonomy for "Unsorted biomass"
## Searching ITIS for "Achillea millefolium"
## Searching GBIF Backbone Taxonomy for "Achillea millefolium"
## 
## Retrieving data for taxon 'Achillea millefolium'
## Searching ITIS for "Crepis tectorum"
## Searching GBIF Backbone Taxonomy for "Crepis tectorum"

## [11] "methods.txt"             "personnel.txt"

# View template
# NOTE: Unresolved taxa lack authority information
taxonomic_coverage.txt
